column4: hi i am curious, i am running feisty with gnome, would i be able to just download the xubuntu iso and update to gutsy that way?
none of your gnome stuff would be updated.  you'd still have to update all of ubuntu-desktop
soundray: is there a way i can install xfce without downloading it? ie, a cd or something like that
if you get the xubuntu alternate cd, you can add it as a repo and install xubuntu-desktop from it
thank you, i will do that
you need the gutsy xubuntu and ubuntu alternate cds.  install the upgrade from the ubuntu one, then install xubuntu-desktop from the xubuntu one
yes, it has to be alternate in order to use it as a repository
okay so i will get that one, the live cd so i can update to gutsy, and what else do i need to get xfce?
no not live cd.  you cant update from live cd.  it has to be the alternate.
okay, so i am getting the alternate gutsy update one, do i need the alternate xfce one as well?
yes.  both have to be alternate.
system > admininstration > software sources lets you add the alternate cds as repositories
so if i get the alternate cd for XFCE, i can add it, and install xfce that way AFTER i update to gutsy? right?
yes.
and if it's ntfs, there are crazy things windows couldve done to it before
should always defrag ntfs before partitioning, and if the partitioner warns you it could be inconsistent, do as it says and chkdsk /f from windows twice
there's actually like 3 knowledgeable people and 7 newbies in here right now.
what format was the partition?
it was fat32
there are diagnostic tools on Helix (Knoppix based forensics distro that runs from cd) that you can use for recovery
any will do
if you have two optical drives
